page.title: 17SHOPPING IN GAINFORD
page.content: {SHOPPING}In Gainford today there are only{eight shops,}a newsagent's, a small supermarket, a butcher's shop, two general dealers', a fish and chip shop, a post office and a hairdressing salon. The number of shops has {decreased}over the years, due to the easier access to neighbouring towns, e.g.{Darlington and Barnard Castle. } In May this year the village's only bank closed, many people were most annoyed with{Barclays Bank. At the beginning of the century in Gainford there were over{twenty shops, five grocers', four cobblers', a miller's, a confectioner's, and a dressmaker. In these days when there was litle transport the village was {self-sufficient.}None of the villagers needed to travel out of the village so everything had to be provided for in Gainford itself.
